meanings.definition: Lack of the usual social or ethical standards in an individual or group.
meanings.sent1: The community felt lost in anomie after the rules were forgotten.
meanings.sent2: The professor discussed the concept of anomie in sociology class.
meanings.sent3: The party turned into a chaotic anomie when the music suddenly stopped.
meanings.sent4: In the absence of guidance, the team experienced an anomie of values.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the abandoned town reflected the anomie of its inhabitants.

meanings.definition: A condition in which society provides little moral guidance to individuals.
meanings.sent1: The lack of moral compass led to an anomie within the community.
meanings.sent2: The novel highlighted the consequences of societal anomie on its characters.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show humorously portrayed the effects of anomie on everyday life.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting symbolized the pervasive anomie in modern society.
meanings.sent5: The film depicted the struggle of individuals caught in the web of anomie.
